snippet: The Securities and Exchange Commission could be more active in guarding state and local agencies against the financial firms that underwrite their bonds.
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column contends that the Securities and Exchange Commission could be more active in guarding state and local agencies against the financial firms that underwrite their municipal bonds; holds that calls for greater oversight are welcome, particularly given how Wall Street has hornswoggled some muni issuers over the years, adding that muni investors and issuers have been burdened by opacity for too long.
lead_paragraph: The Securities and Exchange Commission could be more active in guarding state and local agencies against the financial firms that underwrite their bonds.

headline.seo: Muni Issuers Could Use More S.E.C. Protection — Fair Game
headline.main: Police Protection, Please, for Municipal Bonds
headline.print_headline: Police Protection, Please, for Municipal Bonds
